style.name: English-Style Brown Ale
style.description: English brown ales range from copper to brown in color. They have medium body and range from dry to sweet maltiness with very little hop flavor or aroma. Roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Low to medium-low levels of fruity-ester flavors are appropriate. Diacetyl should be very low, if evident. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

data.name: Crooked Cabin Ale
data.description: Our rich English-style brown ale is smooth drinking and full of malty goodness, with notes of caramel and toasted bread. Great for those shy of the hop and a fan of full-bodied flavorful beer.

breweries.name: Lawson's Finest Liquids
breweries.description: Lawson’s Finest Liquids, LLC is based in Warren, Vermont and distributes small, custom batches of unique beer through their exclusive wholesale distributor, The Beer Guy, LLC. Sean Lawson, founder and brewer, has been an avid home brewer for nearly twenty years, with numerous award winning recipes. Lawson’s Finest, with a small batch system, can custom craft specialty beers for establishments and events. Limited in availability by design, these rare beers can only be found near the Mad River Valley of Vermont.

We've been meeting and exceeding the quality of bigger breweries, despite our small size for over 5 years.

data.name: Deep Cover
data.description: Deep Cover Brown Ale is brewed in the tradition of the brown ales commonly enjoyed in the U.K. Despite its reddish-brown color, it is light bodied and slightly sweet, making it a very drinkable and refreshing brew. Dark caramel malts lend this ale its rich color, while toasted and Munich malts provide just enough body to be truly enjoyable.

breweries.name: Left Hand Brewing Company
breweries.description: Left Hand Brewing Company has been brewing world class, award winning beers since its founding in 1993. They see their beers as a wonderful liquid food to complement meals and social occasions. They strive for the perfect balance and harmony between malt and hops in every beer, from a golden crisp Polestar Pilsner to a roasty, black Wake Up Dead Imperial Stout,  —allowing a truly unique and flavorful with every glass.

data.name: Dick Tracy
data.description: The very first BentSpoke mash! We thought we’d keep it simple, so we made a fruity, nutty Belgo inspired hoppy brown ale.

data.name: Dirty Hippy
data.description: Winner of a Silver 2014 World Beer Cup Medal, this easy drinking English Brown Ale features a complex toasty, malty aroma with hints of toffee and dark fruit. The smooth malt flavor finishes with a touch of sweetness and roasty bitterness.

breweries.name: Triptych Brewing
breweries.description: A triptych (trip-tik) is a work of art, divided into three equal parts and built around a common theme. Triptych Brewing is three guys from three different walks of life sharing our passion for great, local beer with YOU. Built upon the traditional ingredients of hops, barley, and water and serving the communities of Champaign, Urbana, and Savoy, Triptych Brewing is dedicated to exploring the art of craft beer with the community.

data.name: Dog Day Brown English Brown Ale
data.nameDisplay: Dog Day Brown English Brown Ale
data.description: A smooth, toasty brown ale with hints of caramel and cocoa, the malt body has the depth to stand up to cool weather, but does not come across as heavy. This balancing act is aided by the generous use of American hops. A lighter brown beer brewed with Williamette and East Kent Goldings hops.

breweries.name: Hogshead Brewery
breweries.description: Hogshead Brewery and Tap Room has been designed and developed to provide a variety of beers with an emphasis on English ales in a warm and inviting atmosphere with a neighborhood friendly feel. The Slo-Hi location was developed to allow a local clientele, as well as beer aficionados and lovers of good times a central spot in Denver to enjoy a proper pint and have a chat. We will always have three to four great beers on tap via CO2 pressurized kegs and plan to maintain properly conditioned Real Ale from naturally carbonated casks served from beer engines for those that enjoy this traditional British libation. The brewing system and associated cellar has been custom designed with an integrated control system, that allow the brewer to process from one to ten barrels in a batch process and ferment in temperature controlled Stainless Steel vessels. Each of the beers have been formulated from carefully selected malted barley, treated water, multiple varieties of hops, and a specific yeast strain to produce the flavor, mouth-feel, alcohol content, aroma and bitterness, as well as the complex flavor profile according to the time and temperature recipe intended by the brewer. In addition to the attention to detail required for consistent and repeatable brews the brewmaster and support personnel follow a disciplined regiment of cleaning manually, and automatically with Clean-In-Place Systems (CIP) to exclude off-flavors, contaminants, and other undesirables in our beers. Every beer we serve has been naturally processed without the assistance of filtration which is why we are intensely focused on the highest quality ingredients, temperature controls, and finish aging to serve a quality product that we hope you enjoy as much as we do.

breweries.description: The Downtown Grill & Brewery is a nice brewpub downtown with patio seating on Gay Street as well as a back porch. The atmosphere is lodge-like with rich wood and copper brewing equipment. There is also a private room you can rent upstairs.

data.name: Downtown Nut Brown
data.description: A classic Northern English Brown Ale that is very easy drinking and perfect for a brisk fall afternoon. Our nut brown has a subdued roasty palate complimented with a touch of hops to balance out the malty, medium bodied roast flavors. With a beautiful medium brown hue this English ale is designed to please the palate during any season.

breweries.name: Brugge Brasserie
breweries.description:
Located in Indianapolis’ Broad Ripple Neighborhood, Brugge Brasserie specializes in award-winning handcrafted ales and classic Belgian brasserie fair.

The landscape of Belgian beer includes a dizzying array of styles. Each of them offers the drinker something extremely special. Our selection of handcrafted beers looks to honor the Belgian tradition while keeping a firm grasp on our Indiana roots.

breweries.name: Dubrue
breweries.description:
Duluth is an old industrial city and a thriving tourist destination. A city that used to boast 3 major production breweries among its ore docks, wheat granaries, and timber barons is now home to at least 5 microbreweries and brewpubs. Maybe it’s the water – fresh, cold, and right outside our door.  
 
Dubrue is building on this rich and local brewing history with a 15 bbl system located in the heart of downtown Duluth. And we’re brewing in the established tradition: start with great ingredients – fresh water, barley, and hops – and end with a satisfying brew. Our Duluth roots, combined with west-coast training and 10 years of brewing and building recipes, help us focus on consistency in our flagship beers: an irresistibly drinkable Pub Ale, and a hoppy and inspired India Black Ale.

style.name: English-Style Brown Ale
style.description: English brown ales range from copper to brown in color. They have medium body and range from dry to sweet maltiness with very little hop flavor or aroma. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Liberal Cup Public House and Brewery
breweries.description:
The Liberal Cup Public House and Brewery opened its doors in Hallowell in 2000. Since then, we’ve developed a following who truly appreciates our brews and food in a comfortable atmosphere. As the name suggests, we believe in quanity as well as quality. Whether it’s one of our standard 20oz pints or a heaping plate of Fish and Chips, we guarantee you won’t leave our pub thirsty or hungry.

Beer holds a special place in our hearts and minds; it’s our life mission to pour you the perfect pint. Throughout the year we produce 21 different ales and lagers, each one with a distinct character. We run the gamut from a Pilsner to a Cask-Conditioned Bitter to an Oatmeal Stout. You’ll have to drop in to see what’s on tap at any given time, because 115 Water Street is the only place in the world you’ll find our brews. As we like to say: “Brewed in Hallowell, Drunk in Hallowell”.

If for some silly reason your friends don’t drink beer, we also have a full wine and liquor selection. And because everyone likes to eat, we produce loads of fresh, home-made meals that appeal to all appetites. So, please come visit us and enjoy all the charm of an English pub, without the hassle of going through customs.

breweries.name: Dundee Brewing Co.
breweries.description: At Dundee Ales & Lagers, we support all beer lovers on their adventure through the world of craft beers. We believe wholeheartedly in great craft beers that invite and reward you; craft beers that you'll want to reach for again and again. We brew a range of of styles in which all the ingredients are perfectly balanced and work together to offer a flavorful, complex brew that's true to the original style but never over-the-top or intimidating. That's the kind of beer we brew. Because that's the kind of beer we drink. Cheers!

data.name: East Brown & Down
data.description: Our seasonal NutBrown Ale features six malts: CaraAmber, British Brown, NW 2-row, Crystal 75, and both light and dark Munich. Flavors slowly develop from the crisp and dry first sip, with caramel roastiness emerging to be replaced by a raw hazelnut finish on the back of your palate. Hops are subdued; there is a slight bitterness and minimal hop aroma. We use German Perle (PUR-lee) and Saaz (Saw-z) hops from the Czech Republic (how exotic) for a hint of spiciness.

breweries.name: The Prodigal Son Brewery and Pub
breweries.nameShortDisplay: The Prodigal Son Brewery and Pub
breweries.description:
Pendleton, Oregon. A small agricultural town located at the foothills of the beautiful Blue Mountains. And now home to some of the best beers in the state. We’re passionate about fermentation and it shows in our brews. Whether it’s a dry-hopped Northwest IPA or a malt-heavy Porter, the Prodigal Son is dedicated to exploring the possibilities of grain, hops and yeast. Creativity is something we value in our Ales and it’s our goal to incorporate regional ingredients into beers that go beyond convention. Brewing to style is not our objective; we prefer to focus our explorations on the potential of beer.

But we’re more than just brewing, we’ve got good food to boot. The Prodigal Son features a menu that combines traditional pub fare with scratch cooking. Here you will find regional ingredients incorporated into handcrafted cuisine. We have a bona fide chef with an artist’s muse- and his work is truly the product of inspiration. Our food is unique –you might even say it has character.

We’re proud to be back home, here in Eastern Oregon. Come visit anytime, and stay as long as you like. We hope you will join us on our journey to beervana. Lucky for you, your efforts will be rewarded with good beer.

breweries.name: HeadStrong Brewery
breweries.description:
Welcome to Douglas, Wyoming and the upstart of HeadStrong Brewery. Over the last couple years, we have been gradually developing a plan and product to bring to our community.  Craft Beers!  

Our promise to our customers is that we will not compromise on the quality and ingredients we put into every batch of beer we brew.

Our selection of materials will emphasize the Wyoming and Douglas experience while bringing ingredients from around the world to our customers.  Each of our craft beers will be highlighted and served in it's own special glass that will enhance the look, feel and flavor of the brewed product.

data.name: English Nut Brown
data.description: St. George Nut Brown Ale is a classic English-style Brown Ale with flavors reminiscent of biscuit and caramel that is well balanced by a mild hop character. This beer was traditionally served in taverns as their house beer. Our Nut Brown Ale is light brown in color with a thick creamy head.

breweries.name: St. George Brewing Company

Brewmeister has come of age as a brewery of craft beers with its 'brew haus' and 'celler' sharing a 10,000 square foot facility located at 204 Challenger Way in Hampton, Virginia. B.A. Brewmeister currently trades as The St. George Brewing Company & Olde Richmond Ale Company.

data.name: Englishman
data.description:
The Englishman is coming! and it will change your view on the traditional Southern English Brown.

This classic pub ale has been enjoyed in the south of England for over 200 years. An eminently sessionable choice with amazing toffee and wondrous chocolate aromas. You can't miss the dark fruity notes of figs and plums while enjoying this ale. Wish you could enjoy a London-like drinking experience? Now you can. Cheers!

breweries.name: Chapman's Brewing Company
breweries.description: Chapman's Brewing Company is here because you care about what you drink. Everything we do, from working with orchards in Michigan and Washington to the selection of cans instead of bottles is completely focused on making the highest quality beers and ciders in the Midwest. Please come see us at the brewery in Angola – any Chapman’s employee you meet will also be an owner of the company and wants to hear what you think of our craft.

breweries.name: Against The Grain Brewery
breweries.description:
Louisville's only brewer-owned brewery is, like most worthwhile undertakings, the product of dissatisfaction with the status quo. The Louisville area has had a number of quality brewpubs for some time now, but still there was simply not enough beer! Against the Grain is an effort to help solve this problem. We maintain a diverse array of beers covering all of the major categories of beer flavor while generating an endless stream of innovative new brews. In short, everything is "specialty" Boredom will be extremely difficult.

Our food is designed with same philosophy as our brewing. Fresh and interesting smokehouse fare with a gastropub flare lets us bring you the very best flavors to stand alone and to compliment our beers. Regular menu changes allow us to take full advantage of the best seasonal ingredients, our chef's whim, and optimal pairing with our dynamic beer list.

Throw your preconceived notions right the hell out the window. We aren't just another brewpub. We are Against the Grain!

data.name: Euforia Toffee Nut
data.description: A true DuClaw Brewing Company original, this style-bending, English Brown Ale variant is dark brown, medium-bodied, creamy, and incredibly flavorful! EuForia combines roasted malt with gourmet coffee to create a jubilant swirl of caramel, almond, and toffee flavors that will leave your palate in a state of ecstasy. First brewed in 2006, this smooth, highly drinkable bottle/pint of 5% abv liquid bliss is available year round, so what are you waiting for? Come on get happy!

breweries.name: DuClaw Brewing Company
breweries.description: At DuClaw Brewing Company, we are very proud of our beers. Our beers have received their fair share of recognition over the years, but even though we put quality first, fun is never far behind ... just look at the names of our beers. How do we come up with them? All we have to say is that there is a whole lot of creativity in those vats of beer just dying to come out, and we never stop till we get it right.

data.name: Exit 8
data.description:
The long-delayed eighth stop on our multi- year trip brings us to, coincidentally, Exit 8 and celebrates what puts the “Garden” in Garden State.

To celebrate Exit 8, one of our big farming areas, we’ve brewed a beer that uses a lost local ingredient: chestnuts–and a popular current one: local honey. This full-bodied hybrid Belgian-style brown ale brings forward a nutty character from the chestnuts, accented by the flavors of honey, roasted barley and oat flakes. There’s a nice spiciness from the Mt. Rainier hops while Chinooks add a touch of pine. Fuggles and Columbus round out the hop profile.

Chestnut Brown Ale
data.foodPairings: Exit 8 pairs perfectly with hearty foods like roast pork, sausages or a nice aged gouda.

breweries.name: Flying Fish Brewing Company
breweries.description:
When Gene Muller founded Flying Fish Brewing Co. in 1995, he did so first on the World Wide Web - making it the world's first virtual microbrewery. That early Web site helped generate positive press coverage and helped attract the investors needed to make the virtual brewery a real one. Muller said the idea was to make the Web site “This Old House meets the World Wide Web”—letting people go behind the taps and see the thousands of details needed to put a microbrewery together.

He also wanted to give beer lovers a chance, via their computers, to roll up their cyber-sleeves and help build the brewery. The site let beer lovers help select and name beers, design t-shirts and labels, volunteer to be a taste-tester and even apply for a job as a brewer. Visitors to the Web site can sign up for FlyingFishMail a monthly e-mail newsletter which now boasts more than 12,000 subscribers.

Muller, who got into the brewing field to become a brewer, trained at Chicago's Siebel Institute of Technology, America's oldest brewing school. He quickly realized someone was going to have to run the day-to-day business of the brewery and now serves as President and Head Janitor (though not necessarily in that order).

Flying Fish Brewing Company is located in Somerdale, New Jersey, approximately seven miles east of Philadelphia. In a state that once boasted 50 breweries, it is the first microbrewery in Southern New Jersey and the first new brewery built in that part of the state in more than half a century. From its opening in late 1996, Flying Fish has tripled its capacity and become the largest of the approximately 20 craft breweries in the state.

breweries.name: Legacy Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Brewer, Mark Mericle:
Mark's legacy is quite simple. While visiting relatives in Bavaria, Germany and having traveled numerous times to the great brewing countries of the UK and Europe, Mark came to this simple conclusion, “American beers are boring and just are not very satisfying”. In Europe and the UK every area had its own local brewery and the beer was fresh and had flavor and a lot of body. So his quest to bring premium fresh flavorful beers to his town was born.

Working as an apprentice with some of the original craft brewers in California, it gave him an a working knowledge and appreciation as well as insight into the business of craft beer. Heritage Brewing was co-founded by Mark in 1989 and was Orange County’s first micro brewery (brewpub) and they also became known as the premier live blues venue in the OC. Several years later Mark founded his production facility in Riverside County and produced products under Heritage’s label as well as producing white label products for restaurants such as Claim Jumper, Wahoo’s, BJ’s Pizza, etc. In addition, Mark's facility produced and packaged many bottled products that have sold in all major retailers throughout So Cal.

Mark has brewed on various systems from 7bbl to 110 bbl, as well as installations and recipe formulations for many local brewpubs. Mark has received numerous awards from local beer festivals, state fairs, national and international beer festivals. Having received over 20 awards ranging from best of show, blue ribbons, bronze, silver and gold, with a Gold medal at the Great American Beer Festival, you can rest assured that the philosophy surrounding Mark, is a quality product every time. Mark's Nut Brown Ale was also celebrated in Michael Jacksons world pocket guide to beer as “world class” .

data.description: Grandma knows best. This English Style Brown ales is poised to be our flagship beer and we couldn't be more excited. We are the only Los Angeles brewery going to the Oregon Brewers Festival this year, and we're taking Grandma with us. We know she'll do us proud. One sip of Grandma's Pecan, and we think you'll agree.

data.name: Hazelnut Brown Ale

data.foodPairings: Why not try some good Southern BBQ, and beef; maybe even some earthy cheeses like Fontina, Asiago, or Colby. Perfect for those chocolate lovers out there!

breweries.name: Shmaltz Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Shmaltz Brewing Company is an American craft brewing company that brews He'brew Beer. Shmaltz is known for blurring beer styles and using puns, art, history, and pop culture in every aspect of its products. 

Founded as the first and still only "Jewish-celebration beer," proprietor Jeremy Cowan established the company in San Francisco in 1996 with the first 100 cases of He’brew Beer hand bottled and delivered throughout the Bay Area in his Grandmother’s Volvo. He’brew now sells across 35 states, through 40 wholesalers and nearly 5,000 retailers. 

After 17 years of being an outspoken cheerleader for contract brewing, Shmaltz recently broke with tradition and opened its own New York State production brewery in Clifton Park, NY, 10 minutes north of Albany’s capital district. Shmaltz’s new home boasts a 50-barrel brewhouse with 30,000 barrels of annual capacity. The new brewery packages 12 and 22 ounce bottles and kegs of their diverse core and seasonal favorites, and hosts fans and beer tourists in their new tasting room for tours, barrel-aged previews, and special releases.
